info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:33PM EDT until March 31 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL ALLEGANY AND NORTHEASTERN MINERAL COUNTIES... At 333 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Ridgeley, or near Cumberland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Cumberland, Ridgeley, Cresaptown, Potomac Park, Wiley Ford, Flintstone, Spring Gap, Wolfe Mill, Patterson Creek, Pleasant Valley, Short Gap and North Branch. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
